Key Arguments: The proposed legislation undermines democratic rights and freedoms, particularly freedom of speech and expression.
Top-down, heavy-handed government approaches do not promote trust in institutions, as evidenced by recent trends in public trust and political engagement.
The bill's authoritarian approach will decrease trust in government and foster disunity.
The exemption of government-authorized content from the bill is seen as hypocritical and unjust.
Notable Quotes: This proposed bill to combat 'misinformation and disinformation' must be wholly rejected.
This is the kind of proposal that someone might expect under a Soviet-style regime. Not in Australia.
